website_summaries.verdict: Inspired by another classic hobby, this 962-piece set gives the look of an authentic ship in a bottle. Comes complete with a buildable cork and wax seal.
pros: Bottle on stand measures 3"H x 12"W x 3"D. Includes classic crow's nest, sails, flags and cannon
Comes with display stand and nameplate
Also includes an instruction booklet and designer information
cons: Bottle can be a challenge to assemble/keep assembled

customer_reviews.title: Not for kids but excellent for adults
customer_reviews.text: I am a big Lego collector (adult) and I couldn’t wait to get this set. Picked it up for a sale price to make it even sweeter. This is not a set for kids. There is zero playability. I bought this to put in my office and it immediately was the talk of the job. It’s a perfect size to display on the desk. I’d highly recommend if you have a place to display it. The build wasn’t too bad except all the clear pieces can be tough to sort through. But it’s worth it and I’d even buy it at full price if I had to do it all over again.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Without a doubt the most nostalgic novelty Lego has ever made!
customer_reviews.text: I was offered same day free shipping and it arrived less than 12 hours from when I ordered it, now I'm not saying everybody might have that opportunity but it certainly added a star for this review. This item was one of the best lego set I have ever bought! As shown in the picture its bigger than expected and the glass pieces were flawless meaning no scratches or discolorations. This will always be my go to item for gifts I guarantee it.
customer_reviews.author: MooseBurger

customer_reviews.title: ... gift to my 9 year old grandson - a super Lego fan
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift to my 9 year old grandson - a super Lego fan. He breezed along until he stumbled a bit on the bottle construction. A few days later he was back to conquer it. I'm so proud of his perseverance and happy to have been the gift giver of this wonderful project!
customer_reviews.author: Grandma Joyce

customer_reviews.title: Another great Lego set for exhibition
customer_reviews.text: It took me about 4-5 hours to build and it was pretty easy. You start with the ship, then the bottom of the bottle, then attach the ship to that, then the rest of the bottle and lastly the base. There’s no way you can build the bottle first. Take into consideration that when you follow the instructions the model ends up with the top of the bottle to the left instead of the right, as the box originally shows.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel

customer_reviews.title: Simple, but awesome Lego set
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS. I love the idea of a ship in a bottle, and to be able to build one using Legos? Perfect. Spent a weekend afternoon building this and absolutely love it. It is simple to make, but it looks so damn awesome. I have gotten many people saying how much they liked it. It is my favorite Lego set that I have built even though it was one of the easiest. The end result is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: David E

customer_reviews.title: Mostly fun to put together
customer_reviews.text: I made this with my 6yr old daughter who did most of the building. She really enjoyed it until we got to the clear bottle part. While it looks really impressive it is more delicate than I'm used to finished Lego projects usually are. The "water" pieces are fun (you just pour them in) but you don't get to play much with it in fear of breaking the bottle in half. All in all it was a mostly fun build and the result is definitely attention getting.
customer_reviews.author: Zachariah Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Very cool
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to my son on his 20th birthday who has loved Legos throughout his childhood. He was excited and happy when he saw it. It is a wonderful Lego item that any adult or older child should have. Very cool
customer_reviews.author: Zuska

customer_reviews.title: What! A ship in the bottle? By LEGO
customer_reviews.text: I’m a new veteran of building LEGO architecture set “the Great Wall” and now the LEGO ideas “Ship in a bottle” I’m not as young as I used to be at 70 years old. I’m able to follow the step by step instructions and complete the fine motor tasks of building this superb model.It took me about 10 hours to complete the ship in the bottle. It’s very high quality and a collectors item. I look forward to build more LEGO models. Sincerely George Gooch
customer_reviews.author: GEORGE R. GOOCH

customer_reviews.title: The Leviathan is bottled up
customer_reviews.text: An amazing look. Loved putting this together and was so much fun
customer_reviews.author: Shari

customer_reviews.title: Lego fanatics will love this.
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift for a friend who is a real "lego-maniac". It was a big hit. Easy to assemble and interesting as a Lego Idea set.
customer_reviews.author: GFG

customer_reviews.title: Missing pieces
customer_reviews.text: Package arrived and was sealed properly. Ship is first part to build and everything was good. Bottle is second part to build and right at last few pieces to put together to enclose ship in bottle is when we noticed three single clear bottle pieces were missing so we had three extra colored pieces to improvise, however it does appear out of place with the colored pieces in an area where the clear is supposed to be. Have bought and built many lego sets before and this is the first time where I have had multiple missing specific color pieces but also have multiple variants of other color pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Sk8brd

customer_reviews.title: DON’T BOTHER
customer_reviews.text: My son and I have been putting together the Lego Ship in a Bottle. We were really excited about it as he has always wanted to build a ship in a bottle. We are both experienced Lego builders. That being said, this is the worst kit we have ever done. There are pieces missing, things don’t fit right and it keeps falling apart. Yes, we made it right. It is definitely not the quality of the Steamboat Willie we built or what we are use to from Lego. I would never recommend this kit to anyone. Sorry Lego, we are very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: lnrosy2000

customer_reviews.title: Product in ziplocks partially assembled
customer_reviews.text: I’m very disappointed to find out that this expensive gift for my nephew was re-packaged in ziplocks and partially assembled previously. It was obviously purchased, assembled and returned. Not a happy girl.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Challenging and Handsome Result
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my nephew (he's 9, but he can assemble Lego projects in his sleep) and he was very enthused to receive this set. His mother said he'd been spying it for a few weeks. He went off to start working on it immediately. And, when he was done, he sent us photos. It looked good and is now on display. He usually does the kits marked for 12+ years, so this was in line. Nonetheless, his mother said he found it to be a pleasant challenge.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Shopper

customer_reviews.title: waste of money
customer_reviews.text: My wife bought this piece of crap. She and my daughter has only finished a few parts of it. Now, after a couple of week I can't even see it anymore. Probably ended up in trash already? Who on Earth spend like $$60 bucks on these stupid things really. Not only that there are some many pieces to keep. You for sure will curse it to step on a small piece with your bare feet! I don't think it's worth that much money at all. Probably $15 is more reasonable and I wouldn't be too upset to toss it into the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Tom W

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for gift!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first LEGO work and I do it for my husband’s birthday gift. It is really great. Look buuuuuutiful! Perfect for gift. I decided to buy another one for my nephew who is lego fun!
customer_reviews.author: Gene

customer_reviews.title: My parents LOVED putting this together
customer_reviews.text: First - this is not an item for kids to play with; it's a display set meant to look really boss sitting on a living room mantle or bookcase. This is a set for adults to enjoy putting together, and it makes a great gift. My parents love all things nautical, and they also enjoy Lego. I surprised them with this ship-in-a-bottle, and the absolutely loved it. They enjoyed the little bit of challange this adult set offered, and looks amazing put together. This will make the perfect gift for most adults who will enjoy a little whimsy next to their brass sextant and working barometer
customer_reviews.author: Misanthrope

customer_reviews.title: A Well Received, Fun Gift
customer_reviews.text: The "bottle" is clear Legos that you put together around the model. It looks pretty good when finished, though assembly wasn't at all challenging. This struck me as a bit spendy for what you get and what you end up with, but the novel idea made it special and different enough to be worth the purchase as a gift.
customer_reviews.author: Pop Bop

customer_reviews.title: Do buy the light kit at the same time
customer_reviews.text: A somewhat flimsy build but still nice. Do buy the light kit at the same time, but I recommend building the ship in the bottle first so you know whats going on and just reference the light kit instructions as you go. After building the ship in the Bottle, disassemble it (yeah I know...a pain but I learned the hard way - see flimsy build). Now that you know whats going on with this model, re-build the ship & bottle but this time include the wiring for the light kit as you go. Much easier than ripping stuff apart as they would have you do in the light instructions (again, see flimsy build).
customer_reviews.author: Scott L. Stedman

customer_reviews.title: Great, gorgeous set
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful set. Mine had some scratched pieces on the transparent parts which was frustrating and detracted from the set's beauty. I contacted LEGO and they eventually sent me replacements for all the scratched parts. Now it's assembled in my living room and gorgeous. This is definitely not a set for younger or kids because it's not very sturdy and must be handle with care. But my 6 year old daughter (who, admittedly, is very experienced in all matters LEGO) happily assembled parts of the base and the neck of the bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Shiri Dori-Hacohen

customer_reviews.title: Legos - always a crowd pleaser no matter the age
customer_reviews.text: So my teenage boys didn't ask for ANY toys this Christmas which made me sad as a mom. I decided to purchase this along with their requested electronics and boring adult gifts and guess what was the FIRST thing they decided to open and do when we were done opening presents? You guessed it. This Lego set. It was fun for both of them and it's something they can put on the shelf in their room and not be "embarrassed" by as a teen/adult.
customer_reviews.author: knicks1013

customer_reviews.title: Tired of isolation? Start here
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my adult self to pass some time while I'm WFH and what an awesome experience. I haven't really touched Legos since I was in grade school, and I don't have kids. This single handedly made my night while we're all being isolated, and granted at 900+ pieces sounds it can sound intimidating, but this set has clear directions and was not difficult to assemble. I went ahead and ordered the Saturn IV rocket ship because of how well I now like the Lego Ideas series and would recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Erik F.

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to assemble
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a birthday gift for my nephew back in the end of June. He has a hobby for assembling complex lego sets along the lines of the Taj Mahal set and others. I thought this would be a fun project for him and seemed unique but as he tried to put the pieces together for the initial structure it would just fall apart. I even stepped in to help him but to no avail. Eventually he got frustrated and put the pieces in his free play. So not a total waste but i was highly disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Ra M.

customer_reviews.title: Bravo, LEGO!
customer_reviews.text: When I went to go visit my family on holiday, I decided to pick up this as a nostalgic pat-on-the-back. Assembly was a little more difficult than the LEGOs I remember as a kid, but honestly is a testament to the grade-A quality of build instructions. (Can I make a note that the instructions booklet was a *booklet*, with a real spine and everything?) I put on a favorite podcast and voila, in a three relaxing hours I had it assembled and it looks just amazing. I think LEGO has a real market with adults, they just need to keep pushing these kinds of ideas with em.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Z

customer_reviews.title: Received FAKE product through Amazon Warehouse
customer_reviews.text: So I was looking to buy this item as a gift and Amazon offered me a product with “cosmetic packaging issues.” Since it was for a child, a gift, I purchased it. Product was FAKE. Very clearly NOT LEGO brand. Returning it but BEWARE. Customer service was only marginally helpful, I still have to reorder and hope that maybe I will get an actual LEGO product. As you can see my purchase was vetted by Amazon Warehouse. But the brand name is clearly incorrect. The cannot assure me that my new purchase will actually be A real LEGO set. Awful. As a 10 plus year Prime Member, Amazon, you have got to do better.
customer_reviews.author: Saun

customer_reviews.title: Great Date Night Set
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I bought this during quarantine to do during a "date night". We put the ship together in phases, spending an hour per session in order to make it last longer. Total time to assemble was around 4 hours, but we took our time and had fun with each of the pages. It was easy to put together, and the finished product is awesome. We have it on display, and I would recommend this set to anyone. Makes a nice display piece and is fun to put together!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorite builds.
customer_reviews.text: This is one of my all time favorite LEGO builds. The end result is beautiful and the creation of it is astounding. Sometimes it’s one or the other but this time it’s both. The cost / entertainment ratio is super cheap/ high entertainment compared to sets that are 100 plus . I will look into getting more ideas sets because of this one.
customer_reviews.author: Jason D. Griffith

customer_reviews.title: Fun and different lego project
customer_reviews.text: Gave this Lego project to my 10 year old granddaughter who is a Lego fanatic. She was intrigued by this unique Lego project and thought it was a lot of fun to assemble. However it was not quite as challenging for her as I had hoped, but as I stated, she is a fanatic over any Lego assembly! It is an interesting and delightful Lego gift.
customer_reviews.author: cmansour

customer_reviews.title: Great gift idea for that Sailor in your life
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to someone who works on large ships. I even put some custom stickers on the Lego sails and such. Looked terrific and got a big 'wow'. I'm experienced with Legos so it wasn't difficult for me to put it together. A novice might find some difficulty. Didn't give it 5 stars in value for money because in the end it's still overpriced plastic. *shrug. Bottom Line: Would recommend to anyone who thinks it looks neat or likes ships in a bottle. Would buy again for myself if only it were cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: C Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Mostly worth it.
customer_reviews.text: So the set was cool, my only gripe was that 230 odd pieces of the 900 and change pieces were blue little round pieces to look like water. Also 230 odd pieces are not nearly enough to give it the desired result. My 6 year old was able to follow the instructions and put 90% of the set together with minimal assistance. The bottle was a little frustrating and if you intend this to be a display piece I recommend getting out the super glue.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Its Legos and Pirate-ish so its 5 stars for that alone.
customer_reviews.text: I wouldnt recommend this for a young Lego lover, it's very repetitious, BUT for if you're like me and you love Legos AND pirate stuff....well then there really isn't anything cooler to buy on Amazon. There aren't a lot of special hidden secrets with this build, you get what you see and it's perfect. It sits on a mantel and looks awesome. I like that there isn't anything "to do" with the this set. Little fingers could easily pop this set open and there would be quite a mess to clean up.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Nice build and looks nice
customer_reviews.text: It’s LEGO. Nice build and looks nice. Don’t thing it is worth over $40.
customer_reviews.author: Iamthe1

customer_reviews.title: Make sure all parts are there!
customer_reviews.text: This was for my grandson who can put legos together with ease. There was apparently about 10 pieces missing that he didn't realize and he thought he couldn't do it and was in tears. Plus not a easy way to contact shipper to get needed help. I got this to help with the quaratine since he just got over the flu.
customer_reviews.author: purplegram2

customer_reviews.title: Scattered but wonders of fun!
customer_reviews.text: Wish the small bags were organized better so we could just do it one bag at a time and not scatter a bunch of pieces risking losing some, but the whole family had a ton of fun doing it.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Penney

customer_reviews.title: Easier build than expected, but cool
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for fun projects for my son over the summer and he loves Legos, so I purchased this for him. He was able to put it together in like less than an hour. He is really good at building, but I thought it would be at least a day long project for him, so hoping it would last longer. I had told him I wanted to help him with it too, but it was like by the time I had turned around it was already built. Oh well, he liked it and it now looks cool on his shelf in his room.
customer_reviews.author: Hellie

customer_reviews.title: A definite HARD PASS
customer_reviews.text: Garbage. As a huge Lego Fan it upsets to leave anything less than a 5 star review. I just can't. This set is a joke. Barely stays together. 200 of the 1000 or so pieces are just dumped in to add the water effect. I would say the base is more impressive than the actual bottle. The upper half of the bottle is very fragile and hardly wants to stay together. I wouldn't recommend this set to anyone, it was a very frustrating set.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher McCune

customer_reviews.title: Missing pieces
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriends son opened this last (it was a christmas gift from me) and there were pieces missing. Not satisfied at all. He got about half way through it and that’s when he found that multiple pieces were missing. He was supervised by an adult while assembling and they confirmed the pieces were missing as well.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Kabat

customer_reviews.title: Closer to a 700 piece build as the light blue bits are just poured into the model
customer_reviews.text: This was an enjoyable quick build with a few fun features like a spinning compass needle and rotating globes on the stand. Took a couple hours with two people. As mentioned in the headline, a good chunk of the piece count (200-250) is 1x1 light blue pieces that you just dump into the bottle, so keep that in mind if you're using piece count to estimate build time and complexity. Overall, a good set.
customer_reviews.author: E. Lake

customer_reviews.title: Missing Parts- Customer Service Sent Parts Immediately
customer_reviews.text: I was originally very frustrated because a couple of pieces were missing from the part bags. If it was one piece I would’ve thought I misplaced it in the carpet but two pieces and I knew something was up. But I contacted them and they sent replacement pieces right away so I could finish. This is really one of the coolest LEGO sets around in my opinion. There’s even some neat hidden features of this like a compass under the ship.
customer_reviews.author: Morganne Stinsman

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for my grandson
customer_reviews.text: He loves building lego sets and this was his favorite. Very creative piece. I don't know how long it took to put it together but I'm guessing he kept at it until it was completed. It looked very beautiful when finished. I felt it was a bit expensive but the lego brand tends to be a bit more money.
customer_reviews.author: valerie k

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorite small builds.
customer_reviews.text: I love these small Ideas sets, and this might be my favorite. It's unique and looks great. It was not hard to build, and the loose studs for water is a great idea. The one complaint I have is that the end of the bottle is easy to knock off when you're moving the set, but that's such a minor thing I wouldn't let it dissuade me from recommending the set. This is a great shelf piece
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very unique
customer_reviews.text: This LEGO set is very unique and very fun I love it to bits The only complaint I have is that I did not get all the pieces I need to complete the bottle portion of the set I was given the wrong piece and therefor the bottle is not able to go together securely and will fall apart at the slightest touch This does not bother me very much as it is simply a stationary display piece
customer_reviews.author: Alicia Warren

customer_reviews.title: Display worthy!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this set for my 13 year old son for Christmas. He is not into toys anymore, but LEGOs are the exception. He loves building the sets, but then gives them to his brothers to play with and eventually the LEGO bin. The ship in the bottle, however, will NOT be going into general population! He is showing eveowho comes over how fantastic it looks and has told my Husband and I that this will either be displayed in his apartment or his office when he moves out. We will be purchasing more of the LEGO Ideas kits!
customer_reviews.author: LuvCrazyDaze

customer_reviews.title: Nicely detailed lego kit
customer_reviews.text: Nice kit for the money. Bought it for our 8 year old. Had to help him with the more intricate assembly sections but well worth the money and effort as he learned a lot on the way and the outcome looks great! Added a light kit to it and was very pleased with the display.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Great project for all ages
customer_reviews.text: Originally this LEGO set was bought for my 10 year old godson, it looked so cool my fiancé wanted one as well so we ended up buying two. It took us about an hour to put together it was a great project for us to do being in our late 20’s so I know my god son will enjoy it as well. The boat in a bottle is amazing, we are going to glue our set together just because if you do bump into something it’s likely a piece will break off. I definitely recommend this ship in a bottle set. LEGOs are great for all ages!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica L

customer_reviews.title: Parts Missing
customer_reviews.text: I gifted this to my grandson in September and i just found out that several of the pieces were missing. I'm so disappointed because I also bought the light kit for him to add to it, and he couldn't even use it because of the missing parts.☹ He didn't want to return it because he's already put it together as best as possible. But when he picked it up to show it to me, it just fell apart.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Blythe

customer_reviews.title: Solid construction, fun 3 hour build
customer_reviews.text: This was a great build, very fun and interesting look when completed, everyone who’s gazed upon it was in love. It’s about a 3 hour build and anyone saying it “falls apart” isn’t putting it together correctly. It’s a solid build like other LEGO sets.
customer_reviews.author: Chasing Rabbits

customer_reviews.title: Super fun and awesome
customer_reviews.text: I've always been fascinated by ships in bottles, but never learned how to make a "real" one... so I was too intimidated to try. I saw this, and eyed it for months before caving and buying it! TOTALLY don't regret it! It's intensive... and super fun to make and look at. SUPER well-done... really slick build! I also go the light kit to go with it :)
customer_reviews.author: T.C. Hart

customer_reviews.title: Awesome set- Must for Lego lovers!
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome lego set- I call it the Black Pearl (after Pirates of the Caribbean of course!). Took some time to assemble- recommend to do it in multiple sittings. I built the ship inside w/ my friend which was easy- but the challenging part was the bottle itself w/ all those little parts. However- the hard work is worth it- and you'll realize it once you're fully done! Recommend 100% to buy it if you love legos (or just wanna gift somebody who loves them).
customer_reviews.author: Ziaul

customer_reviews.title: Very fun and unique
customer_reviews.text: It was really great to have something unique. I wish there were more unique ones one this. The piece count is deceiving as over 200 pieces are water which means they just drop into the bottle. The base is very detailed and interactive.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: My 45yr old baby brother loved it!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a present for my little brother (who had just turned 45)... my thought was he would enjoy it and his wife would have a toy on the shelf that wasn't star wars or a robot. He sent me a picture when he was done and it is proudly displayed in his livingroom. Score a point for Lego and a big sister.
customer_reviews.author: Holli

customer_reviews.title: SUCH A CUTE DECORATION
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my girlfriend for her birthday! She loves legos, and the first movie series we've watched together was Pirates of the Caribbean, and I thought this would be the perfect gift! It was so fun to assemble and a perfect size for decoration in our room! PLUS IT'S SOOOO CUTE!
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Reglos

customer_reviews.title: Fun build, cool finished product
customer_reviews.text: This was fun to assemble, although the bottle pieces were a little challenging to get right, due in part to me missing a couple pieces that were supposed to be used 🤦🏻‍♀️. Very happy with this purchase, as I typically am with Lego products.
customer_reviews.author: AMoore2009

customer_reviews.title: Great set! So much detail
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my 11yo son. He speeds through Lego sets normally, I wanted one that would slow him down. This set didn’t disappoint. It was a little challenging for him, but he enjoyed putting it together. When asked how many stars he would give this set out of 5, he replied with 10. Not one to play with after being put together but really fun to build. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: shawna

customer_reviews.title: the perfect Ship in a Bottle
customer_reviews.text: My 16 year old son was recently a Pirate in the musical of Peter Pan. I wanted something for him to remember the show by and this is the perfect fit. I love that he puts down the new video games to work on his Legos. It is more complicated than the typical Lego and he enjoys that as well. I'm actually thinking of going back and buying the lighting feature that is available for the finished product.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer Mary Prescott

customer_reviews.title: It falls apart just sitting on a shelf.
customer_reviews.text: I gave this LEGO set to my grandson for a Christmas gift. He is 10 and lives legos. Well this one was very disappointing. He put it together in a few hours. But it won’t stay together. Keep falling apart. The pieces just don’t fit right together. I paid 60 bucks for this set. Very very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Transition Set
customer_reviews.text: My 11 year old son received this as a Christmas gift. This definitely was the most challenging set he has completed. Normally he puts Lego sets together very quickly. This one took him about 2 hours to complete. He got a little frustrated with the bottle part, but he was able to complete it on his own. After he finished it, he said this was the most challenging yet most satisfying set he has ever put together. He wants more of these Lego Idea sets. Finally transitioning from the character theme sets to more complex sets.
customer_reviews.author: Angela R

customer_reviews.title: Great set!
customer_reviews.text: Great LEGO set! Easy to read instructions and the bags are labeled. Only negative was we were missing a few of the small clear pieces for the bottle but it didn't effect the overall structure. Looks great on my coffee table!
customer_reviews.author: B-rainey

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: My great grandson loves legos. But I was running out of ideas for him. He doesn’t have a lot of room to display his works but this took center stage. He’s only 11 but quite smart and had no trouble assembling this. It’s so unique.
customer_reviews.author: mare36

customer_reviews.title: Great gift option & worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my husband and he absolutely loved it. It took about 3 hours for him to assemble. Such a great buy and gift! It came in a protected box. Definitely worth the buy. If you have patience and love building, this is a MUST!
customer_reviews.author: Emma Kahealani

customer_reviews.title: Great for your Collection!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 12-year old grandson. I agonized over the purchase much longer than it took him to put it together ... he finished it in 1-2 hours, including the light kit. The reviews were helpful if you know how to read between the lines. It was a win-win!!
customer_reviews.author: CLPMag

customer_reviews.title: Challenging, nice lego piece
customer_reviews.text: 15 yr. old grandson is a Lego master. He really liked it. I was interested to learn that the bottle splits open so you build the ship in the bottom half and then attach the top. The bottle itself is made if lego parts. Took him a few tries to finish it which is good because I didn't want him to be bored. Good gift choice. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Leggo My Lego
customer_reviews.text: I loved putting this together. Your typical assembly, not as technical as the Technics, this is a good build for a first time build for a beginner who is looking to advance their skills. The plastic for the bottle is very clear and looks incredible.
customer_reviews.author: Zack C.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome lego set
customer_reviews.text: Very cool Lego set. My 8 year old was able to do it all on his own with no issues. Took a good amount of time so kept him busy and provided a challenge. And the finished product looks awesome and is a neat Lego piece to display in our house.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew C. Rosenberg

customer_reviews.title: Instructions are cryptic as usual, but it was a fun build.
customer_reviews.text: The instructions are sometimes a little quirky, the angle of the drawings leaves some areas up to confusion. Some of the design plans are step by step, and some are "make it look just like this". It took my time and enjoyed seeing it come together. It's very well made and looks fantastic on my desk.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I treated myself to this set and oh boy do I love it. It looks stunning on the shelf and I love how versatile it is (Ship can come out of bottle if you want, doesn't have to have the fake water bricks in it, ect.) It was a load of fun to build and I am currently trying to get (unsuccessfully!) a lego octopus to put inside.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Gave this as a gift to a 34 year old!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my son for his 34th birthday. I used to always buy him LEGO’s when he was little and he loved them. I basically bought thus to be funny and he laughed, but, he started on it right away! It was a hit!
customer_reviews.author: Laurath

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun for my husband
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a gift for my better half. He built it as soon as he got it and had a great time. My children are also LEGO fans and were bummed I'd only bought one. Great gift for the LEGO person in your life - or for you if you are that person.
customer_reviews.author: C. Hutchison

customer_reviews.title: Great Gift
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product for children who are advanced and able to comprehend directions vs what they need to be doing. This was a 10 on the difficult scale, however my grandson is 10 and reads at 12th grade level and in a gifted program at school. Even though it's Legos, this one challanged him.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda C.

customer_reviews.title: Really really cool
customer_reviews.text: This is so cool to look at. And the build was very interesting to watch. My husband who is an dedicated lego enthusiast and was very happy to get this as a Christmas present. And it was unexpected even though he pointed it out to me lol so cool
customer_reviews.author: Sierra

customer_reviews.title: Great model.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this with a lighting kit and its great kit to put together. It only hase one poor design area and that is where the 4 quarter pieces come together forming the top of the bottle. Simply not thought out well and too prone to coming apart. Otherwise, it was a lot of fun to put together and put into a cabinet.
customer_reviews.author: GRK_Astronomer

customer_reviews.title: Appropriate for young ages too!
customer_reviews.text: 8 year old boy in Vietnam assembled it in <1 day. I was very pleasantly surprised. He loves ships of all types but I was hesitant to buy this set given the warnings/recommendations of age groups.
customer_reviews.author: Noonan_Danny

customer_reviews.title: Looks exactly like the picture!
customer_reviews.text: This isn't a lego set for children but for adults. It was fun to assemble and looks just like the picture. It's great to look at!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great birthday gift
customer_reviews.text: Love this product, my son and myself made it together for about 5 days, of course we didnot do much time everyday day, it is about 1 hour per day, so after about 5 days, it was done and looks great. It is for grandpa‘s birthday gift. We are all very happy.
customer_reviews.author: The Pacific

customer_reviews.title: Ship in a bottle Lego is awesome.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this as a Christmas gift for our 9 year old. It's awesome! It is a bit smaller than anticipated but I also didn't read the dimensions before buying it. He put it together in a few hours and loved every minute of it. His favorite parts were pouring the "water" into it and assembling the ship.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: husband was extremely surprised.
customer_reviews.text: got this as a surprise xmas gift for my husband. he loves it! i was hoping it would keep him busy over a few weeks in the evenings for a few minutes. no such luck. he was so in to it he put the whole set together in 3 hours straight. he shows it to all of our company and loves how clever it is.
customer_reviews.author: mandy

customer_reviews.title: Great LEGO
customer_reviews.text: My son loved this LEGO set and it turned out beautifully. It was a little pricey for how quickly he was able to put it together but he still had a great time doing it and it looks great on his shelf!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Howle

customer_reviews.title: LEGO!  lower your price
customer_reviews.text: Had a great time putting this together really fun ..I am 35 an thought it was expensive so how is a kid supposed to buy it? But again fun an better than a regular puzzle
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lego Ideas are interesting
customer_reviews.text: This doesn't have the same feel as most lego sets that I have put together. However that doesn't mean it wasn't fun to build. I presently have it sitting on my desk at work. if you have the spare coin I would highly recommend adding this model to your collection
customer_reviews.author: Walker

customer_reviews.title: Truly entertaining build.
customer_reviews.text: This is a really creative build experience. Sure, the whole thing is a bit fragile but so is a real ship in a bottle. Yes, it’s a little challenging to get the ship situated in the bottle, but that would also be the same with a real ship in a bottle. The challenge makes the build interesting and fun.
customer_reviews.author: C. Koeppel

customer_reviews.title: Way too easy.
customer_reviews.text: Yes, there is a ton of tiny pieces, that make it appropriate for an adult, but it's too dang easy. Little challenge and was put together in a couple of hours. So now it's on display, but it's going to end up forgotten in a box soon enough. Wish there had been more to it!
customer_reviews.author: Beach dreamin' in the Rockies

customer_reviews.title: Xmas gift for my husband
customer_reviews.text: Didn't know what to get my husband for christmas, seen this and thought he would enjoy it. He built it with the kids, was a great activity for them to do together. Now its on display by our TV, and everyone always compliments how neat it is! The small globes on the base, under the bottle spin!
customer_reviews.author: ElAce

customer_reviews.title: Missing pieces!
customer_reviews.text: The instructions are very well made along with the quality of the pieces. The biggest issue I had was that there was at least 7 pieces missing which when you consider the price your paying for it there should be a few extra of the smaller pieces of set. Lego is a great product when they include everything one needs to complete the project.
customer_reviews.author: william Flatley

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Really fun build. Perfect for the living room book shelf
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: It was a bit annoying, the pieces to the bottle kept falling apart when you would put a new piece on but at the end of the day it was spectacular when it was finally put together. Bought it for my 10 year old nephew who’s a LEGO fanatic and he completed the whole thing within an hour.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun display for Lego fans of any age
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for 14yr old son who at this point uses Lego architecture studio and some of the architecture sets when he is inclined to build. He said this was an interesting build and likes it for display. Great purchase for anyone who is a current or former Lego enthusiast.
customer_reviews.author: holland1

customer_reviews.title: Great Present
customer_reviews.text: This Lego set was a Christmas present for my daughter who loves Legos. The item arrived on time and made a tween very happy on Christmas morning. We always get compliments on this set which is neatly displayed in my daughter's room. It's a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Suruchi Khan

customer_reviews.title: Clear and pretty
customer_reviews.text: I love it. It was easy to assemble. Instructions was very clear in color. There are some extra pieces. It's very pretty. I'm planning to buy led lights and a case to cover it so it'll shine in the dark and no dust can get in. It'll be a great gift for any occasion.
customer_reviews.author: Shoua

customer_reviews.title: Your mom
customer_reviews.text: Kinda pissed. The kit is a pretty awesome build, but it is a 962 (or something close) piece kit and 284 (actual number) pieces are single-clear-blue-rounds that you just dump in. I expected a bit more building than I got to do.
customer_reviews.author: Carmen

customer_reviews.title: Caution!
customer_reviews.text: Use extreme caution if you handle the bottle by itself after completing the assembly. It might explode in your hands! At least that's what happened to me. LEGO everywhere!
customer_reviews.author: Alan Grupe

customer_reviews.title: Fun but Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: This was as expected from LEGO with the exception that the neck of the bottle falls off readily, and the masts do not lock in place well. Otherwise a fun project.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: This is such a cool LEGO set. It’s fun to build and look at! It’s also able to be a decorative type piece in your home should you choose. I highly recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: smpmplc

customer_reviews.title: We’re really happy with it.
customer_reviews.text: My 10 year old got this for Christmas. She loved it and spent Christmas Day putting it together. This was actually the first time i’d Bought a Lego kit for either of my girls, (you know, avoiding tiny pieces because of tiny mouths). I was really pleasantly surprised that my oldest could follow these directions so easily. She was challenged, but made it all by herself. I also like that the Ship in the Bottle displays so nicely in her room. I highly recommend this set.
customer_reviews.author: Nichole Lynn Dilworth

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: 2 books for scale. Looks just like the picture and I love it! My husband LOVES legos so maybe he's really good at them? But it took him about 1.5 hours to put together.
customer_reviews.author: Gene

customer_reviews.title: Grandson loved this
customer_reviews.text: I know that this is adult rated but my talented 10 year old grandson managed just fine. He likes a challenge.
customer_reviews.author: Gas Girl

customer_reviews.title: Love the look and the build is fun too
customer_reviews.text: Love the look and the build is fun too. However, the piece count is super misleading. 200+ pieces are just the single clear blue pieces that make up the "water." But like I said it looks awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Henrickson

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful project for a grandpa and grandson
customer_reviews.text: We needed a project for a weekend with our grandson (age 9) -- this was just right. The directions were clear and the finished "ship in a bottle" was a hit for both generations.
customer_reviews.author: Grammie-G

customer_reviews.title: Cool Lego Set
customer_reviews.text: Hands down, this is one of the coolest Lego sets we have ever bought. It goes together fast, but looks great. My son has yet to break this set down over a year later.
customer_reviews.author: sussam

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for experienced teens
customer_reviews.text: Really cool LEGO set! Purchased this for our Grandson who is 12 and he loved it! He said it was not difficult to put together, and when it is set on the illuminating stand (purchased separately), it looks awesome! Thanks LEGO for continuing to inspire our grandkids with awesome new sets!
customer_reviews.author: Sheryl H.

customer_reviews.title: Good project for young kids
customer_reviews.text: Fun project for my 10 yr old. The instructions are a bit vague but as long as you pay attention seems to be no problem at all. Nice detailing.
customer_reviews.author: Mandah

product_meta.title: LEGO Ideas Ship in a Bottle 21313 Expert Building Kit, Snap Together Model Ship, Collectible Display Set and Toy for Adults (962 Pieces)
product_meta.description: Continue a nautical tradition when you build the LEGO Ideas 21313 Ship in a Bottle, featuring a highly detailed ship with the captain’s quarters, cannons, masts, crow’s nest and printed sail elements. Place the ship inside the LEGO brick-built bottle with a buildable cork, wax seal element and water-style elements inside, then display the model on the stand featuring the ship’s ‘Leviathan’ nameplate, built-in ‘compass’ (non-functioning) with compass rose and spinning needle, and globe elements. This construction toy also includes a booklet about the fan creator and LEGO designers of this wonderfully nostalgic set.
feature_bullets: Builders of all ages will enjoy completing this advanced building set! The detailed ship in a bottle also includes a LEGO brick stand to display it proudly. This is the perfect model for older kids and adults who love miniature model ships!

This expert model boat building set is built with 962 pieces and features a buildable cork and wax seal element, ship with a captain’s quarters, cannons, mast, crow’s nest, sails and flag, and a display stand with a nameplate.

This nautical collectible building toy includes a display stand so builders can proudly show their creation. It also comes with an instruction booklet about the set’s fan creator and LEGO designers. Builders will love this miniature model ship build.
LEGO Ideas Ship in a Bottle model building kit is compatible with all LEGO construction sets for creative building.
Bottle on stand measures over 3" (10cm) high, 12” (31cm) wide and 3” (10cm) deep, Ship measures over 3" (8cm) high, 5” (14cm) long and 1” (5cm) wide.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars4,037 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
